cs2 update made the game barely playable on my laptop, decided to give the good old classics a try, had this in my library for a while  this game is nearly impossible to play in 2023 due to most community servers being a cesspool of ugly, visually distracting customization that shits on original game's solid half-life low poly aesthetics, power creeping admins and pay to win donation systems, absolutely unbearable community - most people on the closest servers with playable ping rates were not very well-adjusted eastern european boomers who grew up with it, this game's main audience really, and the worst on top of everything - servers that can inject your pc with malicious software, since there is zero restriction or review process on what custom content server admins can force you to download  in the best case you can have some fun with bots (that you have to set up manually, there is a guide, though i swear to god they were a part of the game before?) but you can only play so much with bots  all in all more of a museum artifact of a long gone online gaming era than an actual playable game  a damn shame

Counter-Strike 1.6 was a significant part of my childhood. It was the first FPS game I ever played, and I first experienced it in 2005 on my oldest Steam account, which, unfortunately, I no longer use.   My memories from the days of playing Counter-Strike 1.6 are filled with joy and excitement. I recall the long nights spent gaming with friends, where we fought together in the game and forged friendships that extended far beyond the computer screen  We learned to cooperate, communicate, and trust each other to win matches. These experiences shaped my social skills and taught me the importance of teamwork.  Some of my closest friends today are the ones I met on various Counter-Strike servers. We didn't just share virtual battles but also life's joys and challenges. These friendships are precious, and I'm grateful for the memories we've created together.  Even though time has passed, and we may have lost touch, the memories of those good old Counter-Strike days will always be a part of me. It's amazing how a game could connect us and create lasting friendships that will endure a lifetime. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Counter-Strike √©, sem exagerar, o melhor jogo de FPS alguma vez j√° feito. Feito em 1999, o CS √© um jogo t√°ctico de tiros onde duas equipas (Contra-Terroristas e Terroristas) lutam uma contra a outra, onde para vencer √© preciso ou matar todos os inimigos, plantar a bomba ou desarm√°-la. Para a √©poca, fora uma grande novidade, visto que tratasse de um mod do Half-Life.   Ainda hoje, em pleno 2023, √© um jogo que continua a ser muito jogado - principalmente pelos jogadores da "velha guarda" - e n√£o deixa de ser uma grande fonte de entretenimento para todos! Jogo-o desde os meus 12-13 anos e nunca parei de jogar. Desde novo, a jogar nos servidores portugueses com pessoas a rondar os seus 30-40-50 anos de idade ap√≥s sair da escola. Antigo membro orgulhoso da antiga equipa [TugasMadrugas] (Sr. Bigodes era o meu nome) e de que hoje tenho muitas saudades.   Hoje em dia, os servidores portugueses s√£o praticamente inexistentes, ora porque passaram definitivamente para o CS:GO (agora CS 2), ora porque deixaram definitivamente de jogar. Envelhecer tem destas coisas. Contudo, ainda existem muitos servidores por esse mundo fora e muito activos, estando todos eles praticamente sempre cheios.   Counter-Strike ser√° sempre um jogo que ficar√° para sempre na minha mem√≥ria e √© um jogo que ainda hoje o jogo e que, muito provavelmente, continuarei a jogar por muitos anos. Pelos menos at√© quando puder.   Recomendo vivamente a todos! Muito melhor que o CS 2!

Honestly, a very classic game. However, there is one extreme downside to it: there's no bots. That's right, a Counter-Strike game with no bots. What is this?!?!  Without any bots to play against, you can really only play against players, and that's nearly impossible at this point due to how old this game is and the little community that it has. This game doesn't get many players, meaning it's almost impossible to actually play it unless you stay in a multiplayer server by yourself for hours and hours until someone actually joins.  If the developers add bots, I'll replay the game and edit my review accordingly. I do recommend this game, but my experience has just not been positive, due to the fact that there's nobody to play this game with, making this game basically turn into a "walk around and shoot stuff and do nothing else" simulator.  If this game had fully integrated bots in the base game, it would be much more playable and longer-lasting.

I am recommending this because of nostalgia. If you are someone who has never played counter-strike 1.6, I would have a tough time recommending this unless you want to check out where counter-strike got its roots from. There are some things in this game that are somewhat anti-competitive like crouch walking (some may call it silent-stepping, groundstrafing, g-stafing), quick-switching to reload faster, boosting people through roofs, the insane amount of wall bangs you can do. Some do raise the skill cap. Where this game shined for me was the modding community and the custom game modes. This is where kz started, where surfing started, where scoutzknivez started, bhopping was around before counter-strike but counter-strike had bhop communities as well. This is where weapon skins came from as modders would make custom models for weapons and custom player models. This and counter-strike: condition zero are the only counter-strike games to have a competitive knifing community because the knife mechanics were changed in other versions of counter-strike which made knifing non-competitive. You could get a headshot with a knife; how could you not like that! The graphics are definitely dated by today‚Äôs standards and high fps with a high refresh rate monitor does not feel as smooth as in most modern fps games. Counter-strike has always been one of the best game series for the cost compared to what you get because of the communities and mods that sprung up around it. Counter-strike does not have a built-in matchmaking ladder like csgo. This is the game that really accelerated the esports industry. There has been so much esports history made in counter-strike. The reason why steam was created in the first place was to give people a more efficient way of updating their games and a way to implement a cheating protection know as Valve Anti-Cheat with counter-strike being the main focus. This game reminds you just how good you had it when you were a kid and not many games can rival the impact counter-strike has had on the esports and gaming industry.

[h1]Counter-Strike  - Flashbangs: because who needs vision in a gunfight?[/h1]  [h2]Rating: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ[/h2]  Playing Counter-Strike  is like attending a virtual masquerade ball where everyone's wearing bulletproof vests and armed with AK-47s. It's a dance of strategy, chaos, and the occasional hilarious "no-scopes" that turn the battlefield into a comedy of errors. Grab your armor and get ready to cha-cha with terrorists and counter-terrorists alike!  [h3]Pros:[/h3]  1. [b]Time-Tested Gameplay:[/b] The gameplay is a relic of the past that aged like fine wine. It's like playing a classic board game where the rules are etched in stone, and everyone knows the dance steps.  2. [b]Tactical Depth:[/b] Counter-Strike  is the thinking person's shooter. It's like chess, but instead of knights and bishops, you have terrorists planting bombs and counter-terrorists defusing them.  3. [b]Community and Mods:[/b] The game boasts a vibrant community that's been keeping it alive for decades. Mods and custom maps are like remixes, breathing new life into the familiar tunes of Dust and Aztec.  4. [b]Low System Requirements:[/b] Counter-Strike  can run on a toaster. It's like the friend who's always invited to the party because they're low-maintenance and know how to have a good time.  5. [b]Nostalgia Factor:[/b] For many players, Counter-Strike  is a trip down memory lane. It's like finding your old mixtape and realizing it's still as cool as you remember.  [h3]Cons:[/h3]  1. [b]Outdated Graphics:[/b] The graphics have aged more than a time-traveling DeLorean. For players accustomed to modern visuals, it might feel like staring at a painting from a different era.  2. [b]Hackers' Haven:[/b] The game's age also makes it a haven for hackers who have honed their craft in the virtual underworld. It's like attending a dance party where some folks have mastered the art of teleportation.  3. [b]Steep Learning Curve for Newcomers:[/b] New players might feel like they've stepped into a tactical minefield. The learning curve is steeper than climbing Everest, especially when facing off against seasoned veterans.  4. [b]Limited Variety of Maps:[/b] While the classics are timeless, the map variety can feel a bit constrained. It's like having a favorite dance move, but sometimes you want to try something new.  5. [b]Occasional Toxicity:[/b] The community, while vibrant, has its fair share of toxic players. It's like being the new kid at school; you might encounter a few bullies on the virtual playground.  [h3]Conclusion:[/h3]  Counter-Strike  is the granddaddy of tactical shooters, offering a nostalgic dance with terrorists and counter-terrorists. While it might not boast the flashy moves of its modern counterparts, it's still a classic groove that gets the heart pumping.  [quote=][i]''Flashbangs: because who needs vision in a gunfight?'' - Seriously, who came up with this idea? Were they like, "You know what this intense life-or-death situation needs? A touch of confusion and a sprinkle of temporary blindness!" Is there a secret committee somewhere deciding that gunfights need more pizzazz? "Oh, yes, let's blindfold everyone briefly, and may the best marksman with a sense of direction win!" Did they take inspiration from a chaotic game of pin the tail on the donkey?[/i][/quote]

This game is amazing. The concept is great and it's a nice game to play when you have a bit of extra free time.  It's not particularly deep or engaging but not every game has to be. There are some issues and sometimes the island generator can screw you over but for the most part this is a great game.

Bought it for 2 euro, worth every... well, both of 'em.  It's titled a minimalist city builder and is pretty much exactly that. You just place out buildings, and better placement gives more points, better placement meaning that you have to take into consideration both the natural resources and shape of your islands, and also where you place your other buildings.  It can be a cozy little game to blow off steam, or it can be a meticulous city planner game where you can spend a lot of time learning all the rules and place your buildings carefully. I play it as something in between, and if you enjoy city building games I'd say this game is worth it even full-priced.

This game is deceptively addicting.    It's a somewhat relaxing puzzle game in which you try to place your buildings strategically with or away from other buildings to maximize your points.     Maps are all randomly generated so you never have to visit the same islands twice.    The only drawback that I'll mention is that the music will probably put you to sleep and the color style is slightly harsh to look at.  Then again, these aren't so bad since you can just turn off the music and the graphics can be gotten  used to.

For the price it's a crime not to buy this game. 'Simple but deep' strategy in the style of Mini Metro (but deeper) at its best.  Relaxing entry layer, never overcomplex mechanics but strongly rewards long term planing and is really deep once you start to travel down a few islands!  Again if you have any love for builder games and want a relaxing one for the train or for an even OR if you enjoy strategy/builder games that hide a much deeper layer beneath the relaxing casual exterior Islanders is a no brainer! Love it :-)

The ingame music is also okay, but this game paired with some lo-fi can be a great pause in the middle of the day.

I got this game on sale and wished I didn't, because the developer deserves more that than price I got it on sale for. I will likely get well over 100 hours in this game as it sucks you right in for a great experience. As opposed to a typical city builder with mechanics that are either too complex for most people or too limiting for a fun and unique experience, this game offers simple mechanics that are still complex and diverse enough for a wide range of players to enjoy. If you have extra cash laying around in your steam wallet give this a pick up, you wont regret it!

Great catchy game. I only paid 2 euro for it but it is totally worth the full price. It looks simple at first but it really gets your mind to work after a couple of hours. I managed to get almost all achievements (except 1) in around 7h of playtime so I guess that is pretty fair for a 2 euro game.

Pretty simple but strangely engrossing. Chill out, play as long as you like, your progress will be saved if you need to step away from a while. While minimalistic, there is definite strategy you have to use to get your points up. Each island offers its own challenge and it's unpredictable.

I enjoy the calming atmosphere of this game and how quickly you can jump into it. While it's simple in it's scope, it's also fun to optimize the construction of your islands. I also appreciate being forced to move onto a new island after a bit as it keeps me from obsessing over any individual one for too long.

Its very good and very simple.  Its not worth $5 but definitely $2. The only thing I wish was that it became more complicated / harder the longer you went on. Theres no motivation to keep playing after you see all the buildings. Maybe some challenge modes or something like that? Difficulty settings with a star rating after you lose? Just something to work towards instead of it being mindless.
Peaceful, beautiful, and wonderfully relaxing. Well worth the price.

Highly accessible, perfect for a round here and there just to wind down and relax, Islanders would never be anyone's GOTY, but it's filling its niche spectacularly. If you're even remotely intrigued by this simple and chilled-out city builder, it's worth the plunge.

An absolutely delectable stress reliever of a game. No matter how you approach the simply presented, yet compellingly layered puzzle of placing the buildings you're given in proximity to appropriate terrain features and already-existing structures, you'll always end up making something beautiful. At its under-¬£5 asking price, Islanders is a zen-flavoured steal of a game. On sale, it's insane to not at least try it.

This game is fun and I do totally think it will get somewhere one day, but I do feel there needs to be some feedback to get the game where it needs to be.  *World design Even though I absolutely love the idea of the world being so colourful, I do not think the placement is done that well. It is a bit too open and you kind of just get lost. This would work if the game would add some coins or other collectibles in your path or give some some distant pointers, but right now it just felt a bit like a confusing time to me.  *Difficulty The game in general is not that hard, which in this case is actually not at all a bad thing! However, I think I would like a bit more feedback during combat. Enemies kind of just come running towards you and your melee combos are often fast enough to end them without the need of a counter attack or dodge. I hope that this will change in the future to work a little better and feel like it has more impact!  *Music The music is actually quite nice! It reminds me of a nice mix between Maplestory and Spyro! However, it kind of becomes monotone with how long it plays without any change. I am hoping in the future that this will be integrated a bit better to make it feel like you are really exploring the areas!  In the end, this game is an Early Access game and some of this is totally understandable to happen! If time is put into the right things, this game can easily get a nice cult following or even better!

legitimately good game with some rough edges absolutely packed with love and attention in every nook and cranny lots of (french) voice acting with a lot of character, Carol especially is really endearing and entertaining as the main character she has about as much patience for anything that gets on your nerves as you would, and she's not shy about saying it not to say the game makes light of wasting your time or anything, just that when an NPC makes a proposition for your help in exchange for something you need or an antagonist swoops in at the last second to cause trouble or wrest victory from your hands, she'll pipe up in protest  "comfy" is a pretty connotatively loaded, functionally meaningless word to use to describe a game, but it's apt here I'd say the same for the word "fun" more accurate and helpful words would be lost on a game in early access  if you still think back fondly on games like Jak and Daxter, Ratchet and Clank, Blinx, Scaler, etc. and the visuals here appeal to you I think you'll find something wholesome, nostalgic, and enjoyable in this game
Pretty fun. Camera can be weird but otherwise its good.  You may get lost but exploration is nice since you can shoot enemies in your way.

It's a solid, albeit sort of scuffed third-person 3d platformer/shooter.  Pros: 1. local coop, rare on PC games these days 2. solid shooting and combat mechanics 3. Several completed areas in the main adventure mode (playable with up to 1 other person in coop) 4. Many very high quality and expansive event survival maps.  I find it genuinely more fun than COD zombies, which it borrows heavily from. 5. An old-school versus mode with unique weapon pickups from the adventure mode 6. versus, survival, and event maps allow up to 4 player coop 7. Fun visuals 8. Plenty of secret costumes and collectables  Cons: 1. It's Early Access, so it is fairly buggy.  The most common is getting stuck in geometry from my experience 2. A lot of the animations are very janky at the moment 3. Single player survival/event maps sometimes doesn't spawn enemies properly 4. At the moment, there is no online functionality for versus or coop, but the devs plan on adding it soon.  But for now, unless you have friends to play with, you won't be playing coop or versus.  Miscellaneous Note: The game is designed to be child-friendly, but there are plenty of busty characters/enemies.  This doesn't bother me, but some might not want their kids to see it.

Non, juste non.  Je pense que les devs ont pas compris qu'on est plus en 1991 et que faire un jeu avec une difficult√© de gros fils de p*te √ßa marche plus de nos jours.  Pourquoi ? Et bien c'est simple... En 1991, j'avais 4 jeux sur ma nes, et donc pas trop le choix de pers√©verer. En 2021 il se trouve que j'ai plus de 500 jeux steams.  Recommencer 40'000 fois le m√™me passage parce que ces CONNARDS de devs se sont dit "oh lol on va mettre un passage qui donne l'impression d'√™tre la suite du jeu alors qu'en fait c'est un vieux boss rush pour un item de merde dont le joueur √† rien √† foutre" √ßa me donne pas envie de continuer. Le jeu qui redonne 0 point de vie apr√®s un combat de boss particuli√®rement ardu mais qui fait repop tout les ennemis de la zone d√®s que t'as le malheur d'√©ternuer, c'est pas non plus ce qui se fait de mieux.  Alors maintenant, pourquoi on se souvient de jeux comme super mario bros 3 par exemple (qui est je le rappelle un enfer sans nom dans le monde 8) et pourquoi on ne se souviendra pas de ce tas de fiente ?  Je sais pas perso... Sans doute parce que le jeu n'a pas d'√¢me, et n'en auras sans doute jamais. Inviter des c√©l√©brit√©s de youtube comme Bob Lennon pour faire les voix c'est cool hein, mais engager des b√©ta testeurs pour dire ce qui va pas dans vos niveaux finis √† la pisse, ce serait mieux.  Prendre des cours de level design serait une id√©e aussi. Un jeu de plate-forme c'est pas cens√© √™tre le truc ou je me demande constamment si je suis dans la  bonne direction.  Et pour l'amour de dieu, des checkpoints √ßa vous tuerait ? Un checkpoint √† tuer vos parents pour que vous soyez allergique √† ce point √† ces derniers ?  La seule raison qui fait que je ne peux pas demander le remboursement de ce gros tas de merde, c'est parce que on me l'a offert. Si un jour le jeu est finit peut-√™tre que je lui redonnerais une chance... Mais vu que le d√©veloppement a l'air d'√™tre perdu dans les limbes, √ßa risque pas d'arriver.  Je d√©conseille compl√®tement, √† moins que vous cherchiez un esp√®ce de dark soul sous forme de jeu d'aventure. Les autres passer votre chemin.  Allez a+.

[b]This game looks pretty cute, isn't it?[/b] All colorful, telling the story of a little girl traveling through a wonderland to take back her stolen bunny plushie from a mysterious shadow, this looks like a little game made for little girls. Then the game gives you a laser pistol disguised as a hair dryer, a toy shotgun, and a very real flare gun to burn warthogs and orcs into a crisp. [b]Surprise, this is a third-person shooter, mostly inspired by the fragfests of old like Blood or Doom, and boy, what a charming love letter it is.[/b]  The game's first thirty minutes give you a concise overview of Carol's abilities, from melee combat to platforming, including of course shooting anything that feels somewhat hostile. The game will take it slow at first, introducing the player to the gameplay, and giving him a bit more plastic weaponry as he progresses. This won't last long, however, as the game will quickly pick up the pace, and present [b]an ever-increasing and satisfying arsenal[/b], from water uzis to rifles that shoot foam rounds, a very real flamethrower disguised as a toy, and many, many more. Shotguns are particularly top-tier, none of them feel underpowered. Even the hair dryer would later become an even better sidearm, with powerups found in secret places. Carol will also benefit from other upgrades, most notably a double jump and an air dash, who will definitely accelerate the game's combat. It even has stealth mechanics as an option, which was something completely unexpected. [b]The game would then introduce bonus levels scattered around. They are a nice change of pace[/b] from the main run n' gun adventure, and are pretty varied, from platform levels which may or may not be inspired from Crash Bandicoot, to a kart racing mini-game and a tank battle arena. Some of them give a welcome surge in difficulty, as several deaths are expected. Speaking of a kart race, [b]there are indeed vehicles. Practicing a bit with them is important, but it quickly becomes second nature to control them[/b], some have mounted guns and the game sometimes raises the enemy count, just to give the opportunity to mow them down. Said enemies not only vary in style, but while a good chunk of them only fight in melee, others might have other abilities like using weapons you can pick up, raising ice walls, cast a wave of fire, and more. [b]It becomes easy, even instinctive, to assess a foe's threat just by looking at it. A simple, yet succesfully mastered display of enemy design[/b], seen in other popular games like Serious Sam. [b]All of this taken into account, the game ends up being massive for an indie game[/b]. The adventure mode, by itself, is already 18-22 hours on the hardest difficulty available, without looking (too much) for secrets, and isn't even finished yet. On top of it, there is also several arena modes, all playable up to 4 players, in co-op and versus. For around 18 bucks, you get more content that other games with a bigger budget only wish for.  Onirism doesn't simply take inspirations from other games to build its gameplay, however. [b]The game's universe is filled with videogame references. Some in-your-face, others more hidden.[/b] Among them, we can find Serious Sam (a lot of Onirism's foes do feel and act like Serious Sam's bestiary), but also GoldenEye, Resident Evil, Metal Gear Solid, Blood, Doom, the list goes on. On top of these, the game has a charming universe, filled with brief but funny encounters and jokes that don't go under the belt. [b]Carol, the heroine, steals the show during the cinematics[/b]. With her brattish attitude and her tendency to resolve many of her troubles with ultra-violence, she only needs to steal quotes from Duke or Caleb to become a kid friendly version of your average 90's FPS hero. The other characters are funny, and have personality, but while some will get screentime throughout the adventure, some sadly are here only for a 30-second cinematic, only to be never seen again. [b]Spider mommy and Tex need more love.[/b]  What is definitely the best part of this universe is clearly the soundtrack. Ranging from beautiful ambient pieces, to blood pumping battle themes, the overall quality of the OST goes from "pretty good" to "Gonna wake up the neighbors with that BANGER", with the latter sentence fitting a great majority of the game's music. Personal favorite is that one metal music heard in the more intense arena fights in the ice levels. [b]The store page would look prettier with a "buy the soundtrack" button.[/b]  But among all this praise, there are some elements that give the overall experience a (very)slightly sour aftertaste. For instance, the team is doing his job to optimize the game the best they can, but it's still a bit rough around the edges. Some of the loading times have recently been cut in half, most notably the one to start the game, but you might still have time to rev up the coffee machine before the loading is complete once you get to the later areas currently available. Also, the keybinding, for some reason, the game won't let you bind the middle mouse button to an action, and there is no hotkeys to switch immediately to a preffered weapon, only scrolling through. The options menu, having an awkward scrollbar to check through the keybinds, and being only in english no matter the chosen language (english and french are currently available) doesn't help.  [b]Those imperfections being for the most part very minor, they won't ruin the fun the overall game can provide[/b], those problems can eventually be fixed, and the team shows pure passion for this project, dropping content and bugfixes regularly. [b]They added, for instance, a difficulty selection, a welcome feature to a game that otherwise lacked challenge during 80% of the adventure.[/b]If this is your first game, playing on Normal will be understandable, but should you have some experience with action-adventure games, you can start on Hard or Very hard without any problem, you will get tossed around more often by the bosses and bonus levels, who apparently aren't bound by the rule of "be nice to the player, he's probably a kid", but without doing so, most of the available gear like grenades and elixirs won't find any use during most of the game.  [b]In short, Onirism is most likely one of the most charming and fun third-person shooters you can find in early access. Fast-paced combat, likable characters, lots of content (and more to come), a completely unhinged heroine, and an absolute banger of a soundtrack, this is a love letter to video games that everyone can enjoy.[/b]

Ok, there are enough reviews in french so I'll write mine in english. The video games board from my favorite chinese basket weaving forum made me buy this, so i expected nothing and damn was I wrong. TLDR at the end.  [u]Firstly, the game is in early-access, is it playable right now ?[/u]  YES. I had very few technical problems playing this, but having a really good config is highly recommended, i could only play with graphics on low since my config wasn't good enough for higher settings. This game uses A LOT of RAM so you better have 16GB of it if you want to play this with the best settings. You can still play with 8GB like i did, but only on the lowest settings.  Even with low graphics, the game didn't look bad, it is still completely playable.  Also, you should install it on a SSD, it really lowered the loading times (which are quite long), in comparison with a HDD installation.  The loading screens might appear stuck or freezed, but it's normal, just wait until loading is over : don't click or try anything  in the meantime as the game could stop responding. Sometimes the game wouldn't launch, i never had to launch it more than twice to make it work though.  There are few in game problems, i noticed that sometimes you had to jump over some slopes/steps when it appears you could just walk on them, or sometimes you can get stuck in an infinite fall if you jump on the corner of some objects/parts of the environment, but nothing too bad as i always could go back on my feet somehow. I never fell under the map or worse, even though i tried to parkour in many places. Maybe the game needs a bit of polishing in this matter, but nothing is currently really problematic. Another flaw of the game is the inventory system which is currently kinda bugged and works in a weird way, but i never lost anything though.  [u]Ok but, does it have any content though ?[/u]  YES, took me something like 20 hours to reach and finish the last level currently available on the main adventure. I took my time to do all the bonus levels on the way, and visit the maps to find the hidden guns/skins etc... though. According to the roadmap it's like a third / half of the planned full game.   Then, there are the seasonal events (it looks like they are all available at all times, and not only during summer, halloween or christmas etc...), i didn't play them all yet, but the few i played are really good too. Some event maps are played a la Call of Duty Zombie mode : you have waves of enemies coming at you, perks, guns to buy, doors to open to unlock all the parts of the map etc... And it's not poorly done, some maps are huge with a lot of things to do. These will be great in multiplayer (which is not released yet).  [u]Nice, but what are you supposed to do in this game ? [/u]  The game is a TPS and your character is Carol a 10 year old girl chasing a shady person who stole her bunny plush Bunbun. The story is quite simple, but the characters are good, especially Carol who is trashtalking the enemies all the time. I don't know how are the voices in english, but they're great in french with many references to pop/video games culture (there's even a line taken from Helene et Les Gar√ßons a french sitcom from the 90's, i really didn't expect that !) You can feel that the game is a tribute to old classic games, for example : during the stealth part of game, enemies sometimes barrel roll like the enemies in Goldeneye 64, that's a stupid detail, but it's great ! There are many references to other games/movies etc...  There are a lot of enemies on your way and you have a HUGE arsenal of different weapons to defeat them. There are many different enemies, with boss fights, arena fights, some parts of the game are in vehicles (boat, tank etc...) and bonus levels have other gameplays : side scrolling platformer, obstacle courses...  The game is very diverse and there's already a lot to do.  [u]Well this looks like a game for children, can my niece/son/clown fish play it ?[/u]  This game is okay for all ages, there's nothing shocking in it, no swear words or scary parts, BUT in terms of difficulty this is clearly NOT a walk in the park, so your niece/son/clown fish better be quite the Faze clan 360¬∞ noscope pro to get through some parts of the game. I'm thinking for instance about the arena fight near the observatory of Pinewood city : there's like 6 million enemies coming at you, your health and ammo are limited, you have very little space considering some enemies will build walls on your way, the fight is very long etc... And as I already stated, we're far from the final levels who should be even more difficult.  Even as a good player, you won't get bored and you should brace yourself for some parts. Nothing impossible though.  The controls aren't frustrating or difficult to understand, i just wish dash and sprint were on different keys, just to increase the reactivity of the sprint, other than that the character is fast and has an overall good maniability. Some parts of the maps are impossible to reach yet because the double jump isn't available (or maybe i'm just dumb and missed something), but it happens in like 2 occasions.  [u]In the end, how does the game feel overall ? [/u]  Overall, the game is great and looks highly promising for an early-access, the gameplay is great, there is always things to do, places to explore, guns and outfits to collect. The sound design in nice and the music is really awesome, it's far from being a generic and boring background filler.   Onirism is really refreshing, despite having "classic" game mechanics, they're done in a really good way. It deserves way more fame than other early-access indie games that are rushed/unplayable/indefinitly on stand-by etc... I don't understand how so few people know it considering how good it is. I hope it gets the recognition it deserves, and I'm glad to see more and more people talk about it online.  [u]TLDR[/u]  Buy it, it's a very good game, really worth it, even though there are a few bugs, nothing ruins the experience. Have a good PC though. Some stated that the game is too hard and had too many enemies, or that you could get lost in the maps (they are quite big), but if you're not a complete incompetent it'll be okay. To those, the only thing i can say is : GIT GUD.

The only issue I have noticed was a difficulty to some platforming areas but after a few attempts it is manageable.

Ce jeu est incroyable, mignon, beau, fun. Pas toujours parfait o√π parfois on peut rester bloquer dans le d√©cors, un lent √† d√©marrer chez moi (je n'ai que 4GO RAM aussi) mais fluide in game et parfois, quelques doublages manquant un peu de convictions (mais rien qui ruine l'exp√©rience).  Ce jeu est une claque, bourr√© de secrets un peu comme dans Rayman 3, vous pourrez passer des heures √† chercher juste 1 secret, vous regarderez chaque recoin histoire d'√™tre sur que vous n'avez pas rat√© un d√©tail, une faille, une entr√©e, que vous ne pouvez pas interagir avec le d√©cors avec vos nouveaux pouvoirs. Il dispose d'un prix tout √† fait honn√™te, c'est fait par un petit studio fran√ßais et une bande de pote, le d√©veloppement n'est pas aussi rapide qu'un jeu AAA mais il est fait avec le coeur et on dispose r√©guli√®rement de mises √† jour et d'√©v√®nements tous plus sympas les uns que les autres.  Je recommande chaudement !

Onirism is a very cute and charming title with tons of personality, it's clear a lot of love went into this game. Please don't be dissuaded by the Early Access status, the game has a lot of content available!  The Pros: -A beautiful, magical artstyle with a vivid color palette, and a gorgeous atmospheric soundtrack.  -Rich, large environments to explore with lots of resources, collectibles and bonus levels to discover. -Loads of variety in weapons, equipment and costumes. -Creative weapon designs with a "nerf" toy gun aesthetic. -Fun gameplay reminiscent of classic collectathons, fast-paced combat with tight movement and at times challenging platforming. -Funny and charming dialogue. -Frequent updates and events, and previous event maps are permanently available, you definitely get your money's worth!  The cons: -Checkpoints can be few and far between at times. -Progress is lost on death, meaning you have to re-collect any resources you gathered since the last checkpoint. -No way to access options menu without returning to the title screen. -Sometimes it's unclear what to do/where to go next, no way to check your current objective. -Enemy AI could be better, too many enemy types just rush you. -Needs more gameplay polish and optimization overall, frequently getting FPS drops on a system well within the recommended specs, but as an Early Access title this is to be expected.  In summary, slightly janky but very promising Early Access title that delivers what it sets out to do, has tons of content and is definitely worth picking up, heartily recommended!

just uh, yeah. gonna steer y'all clear of this.  it's VERy rough around the edges, clipping/bugs/forced quits/etc the game is amazingly un-optimized ( it runs really badly, pretty much regardless of whatever you do, it's Unreal Engine used poorly ) and you can't adjust settings in game, and you're forced to sit through an opening cutscene ( unskippable ) if you're just starting the game, and trying to get graphical settings that actually WORK.   I'm not sure buying this was a good idea. The devs haven't worked on optimized the game at all ( if anything, it's gotten worse over time ) they've been adding this ridiculous" not splatoon, not Peach beach splash" MINIGAME sort of deal  " ohboy, we got map 3, how about you work on your actual GAME? " All I've seen for updates is worthless filler content that swells up the already-bloated poorly optimized train wreck as-is.  I couldn't even get past the first MAJOR jump int he game, without getting stuck in mid air, and then unceremoniously being dumped UNDER the map. Thank god they just stuffed random landscape geomtetry under the water, otherwise I would've just been stuck there : under water, but unable to swim. I found rocks precariously stuck out of the world to leap out. A+ coding.  So I even report this major hitbox flaw in the most basioc thing : jumping, and the devs are aware of it - and instead of like... working on issues such as these, we get a multiplayer splish splash water gun game in our " this isn't a hat in time, we swear " game./   no direction, this project is spiraling all over the place - I have no idea what they're doing.   this game is not enjoyable to play, it runs liek a dirty butt, and it's so EA it's not even funny.   huge thumbs down until they get their act together. or by next year, maybe they staple on four more maps to this ludicrous watergun sideproject, or perhaps they ditch Onirsim, and just work on THAt as a stand-alone game? idk, these devs have no focus, no direction, and what little talent they had was squandered away REAL quick.
Its like a rayman-esque 3D platformer but also with guns.

Ayant vu toute la communication qui a eu lieu sur ce jeu je me suis empress√©e de l'acheter car il √©tait √† mes yeux prometteur. En effet, Onirism se d√©veloppe dans un univers o√π vous trouverez des territoires qui invitent √† l'exploration avec un personnage principal attachant et un doublage r√©ussi (pour ce qui a √©t√© doubl√© √† ce jour). Cependant cet enchantement est saupoudr√© de beaucoup trop de poivre pour que je puisse appr√©cier la recette qui a toujours √† mes yeux du potentiel. Les d√©veloppeurs ont r√©unis de parfaits ingr√©dients mais g√¢ch√©s par un probl√®me de... d√©veloppement...?  Je vais tenter de m'expliquer : - Des bugs de d√©butants pr√©sents un peu partout dans le jeu (ennemis qui apparaissent et disparaissent tout seuls comme par magie, votre personnage qui se fige durant la nage, des petites crevasses o√π votre personnage tombe et soit reste bloqu√© soit fini par tomber dans un fond sans fond etc) Vous continuez de d√©velopper le chapitre 3 sans corriger tous les nombreux bugs "mineurs" qu'on retrouve dans le chapitre 1 et 2, c'est un probl√®me.  - Inviter √† l'exploration dans un univers mi-ouvert √ßa fait joli dans le texte mais il y a une diff√©rence entre explorer un territoire inconnu et se perdre quand on veut juste rentrer au village... Vous disiez lors d'une interview que vous aviez fait attention pour que le jeu soit instinctif et que le joueur se retrouve au fil du sc√©nario et qu'il ne soit pas perdu car il sera happ√© par le jeu.  Cependant, si le joueur se perd, ne conna√Æt pas ses objectifs, r√©clame une carte sans arr√™ts comme ce que j'ai pu voir (et vivre) dans de nombreux lets play c'est que votre jeu a un souci. Il n'est pas instinctif. (Je sais qu'une carte est en cours d'√©laboration mais les paroles que j'ai entendu de votre part me laisse penser que vous √™tes persuad√©s que votre jeu est clair et que c'est les joueurs qui ne comprennent pas, ce c√¥t√© me fait un peu "peur" pour la suite, mais j'esp√®re me tromper).   - Vos fautes d'orthographes... Cela arrive √† tout le monde mais pour un jeu anticip√© ouvert depuis un moment vous donnez l'impression de pas vous relire : il y a une faute d√®s la 1√®re fen√™tre du jeu. Lors du chargement du jeu on lit une notification sur la fen√™tre Windows qui peut √™tre bloqu√©e (on parle de la fen√™tre il me semble, donc prenez soin d'√©crire "bloqu√©e" au f√©minin et non "bloqu√©"). Je ne cite que la premi√®re faute, je ne citerai pas toutes les autres mais les gens ont pay√© pour le jeu. Un minimum de professionnalisme ne fait pas de mal.  - La derni√®re pour finir, parce que je trouve √ßa dommage de continuer pour un jeu qui semblait si bien.  Les joueurs comme moi aimeraient beaucoup pouvoir profiter des graphismes qui sont tr√®s agr√©ables, profiter sans se faire harceler chaque secondes par les monstres. S√©rieusement, je n'ai rien contre la baston j'adore √ßa et le jeu n'est bas√© que sur ce principe (parce que niveau sc√©nario il n'y a que des qu√™tes sans int√©r√™ts qui sont des pr√©textes √† la bagarre, on en oublie qu'on est l√† pour retrouver une peluche !) Je trouve que niveau dosage de monstres c'est √† revoir, ils reviennent tr√®s vite apr√®s que vous les avez d√©truits ce qui est frustrant les fois o√π on aimerait √™tre un minimum "pos√©" et appr√©cier les d√©cors... Exemple de probl√®me semblable : il m'√©tait arriv√© d'ignorer tous les monstres crois√©s dans la for√™t pour aller m'acheter vite une arme au village, j'ai fait mon achat tranquille et qui je croise qui m'attendait juste √† l'entr√©e de la porte ? Tous les monstres que j'ai fuit m'ont gentiment attendu, ce qui fait grand monde dehors. La situation serait dr√¥le si je ne passais pas d√©j√† mon temps √† leur taper dessus au point de m'en lasser.  Il y a a plein d'autres points que je n'aborde pas (la gestion de la difficult√©, les v√©hicules aussi souples que des camions bennes, l'absence (ou la flemme?) d'explication dans tout le jeu, les sauts du jeu etc)  Conclusion : un jeu √† acc√®s anticip√© qui est sorti trop t√¥t m√™me pour un acc√®s anticip√©. On a envie d'y jouer mais les d√©veloppeurs ne nous donnent aucun moyens pour l'appr√©cier √† sa juste valeur. Je dis cela car j'ai l'impression que les avis sur les probl√®mes du jeu ne sont pas du tout pris en compte. Depuis que le jeu est en d√©veloppement beaucoup de probl√®mes ont √©t√© soulev√©s par les joueurs et tr√®s peu ont √©t√© r√©gl√©s, c'est dommage car vous avez de bonnes id√©es.  Je peux avoir un c√¥t√© acerbe dans mes propos, mais tr√®s √©trangement j'appr√©cie beaucoup votre jeu. Si je me trompe sur votre bonne foi, (ce que j'esp√®re, encore une fois) vous avez tout mon soutien, ne l√¢chez rien. Je vous prie seulement de prendre s√©rieusement en compte les retours des joueurs. Vous √™tes sur une bonne voie mais √ßa serait vraiment dommage de rester sur cette ligne. Sur ce, bon courage pour la suite !

So I haven't finished Onirism and I'm playing as P2 in a RPT connection, so I'll keep it brief and focused on that.  Onirism is a fun adventure about a little girl through a strange dream dimension, and so far it's turned out to be a rough gem of sorts. There's a lot of good sides and a lot of downsides too, I'll cover those in quick lines.  [b][i]The good[/i][/b] --------------------- +[b]Charming Main character & character designs:[/b] Carol is adorable in both her English and French voices, tending to be a bit of a brat who only does the right thing if it helps her own goals. There's a variety of outfits to use as well!   There's also numerous enemy designs with their own charm, like the plush people and the plantfolks. [spoiler]Also spider designs that dont bother my Arachnophobia, big plus.[/spoiler] +[b]Really tight gun controls:[/b] Onirism has some fantastic shooting controls, a smooth way to swap in and out of them and a whole host of weapons to use and find. And with a small pool of total ammo types, you dont have to micromanage. Also chests found in levels that let you swap and store various guns out on the fly. +[b]Inspired Level design:[/b] Every level you come across tends to be full of color and life in one way or another, giving way to the dream aspect of it all. And several bonus levels come with designs straight out of people who might think fondly of [i]Crash bandicoot[/i], bonus levels like that light-puzzle in the first level, or Honey Sewers in the hive.  [b][i]The Bad[/i][/b] -------------------- -[b]Core Features Missing:[/b] While it's nice to have large, expanded levels its also really bad to do so without a map. Several times both of us playing would struggle to find our direction cause a map was so winding with no markers or map to examine. A top down map that marks out level transitions or goals at the very least would help! -[b]Numerous Bugs (Mainly Co-op):[/b] While this game has local co-op, it definitely needs some polish. There's a handful of bugs that seem to exist primarily in coop mode due to how the game handles it all. This includes: 1) Soft-Lock at Terminal/Hologram chats if both players interact at roughly the same time 2) P2/P1 is spawned as an immovable ghost if a cutscene is triggered by the other player while they're dead 3) P2 can't see their cursor or selection highlight in shop menus if P1 moves the cursor (P1 can also choose stuff for P2 as a result)  There's also some minor nuisances regarding how ladders and spawn positions are handled (Slipping off the sides, accidentally spawning outside the boss room for Hive Totem), but those are easily circumvented in comparison. -[b]Frustrating (other) level design:[/b] While some bonus levels are really fun and feel classic, others can be downright frustrating for reasons unfair or feeling unintended. One in particular that comes to mind is [b][i]windy gate[/i][/b], where platforms you have to hop across rotate. Thing is, they rotate in no particular pattern on timers almost wildly separate from each other resulting in situations that can corner you to fall and respawn.  Im having fun for what its worth, and with a little bit of polish and hopefully an injection for general popularity It can really shine! (Though there's nothing wrong with being a Niche, good game either.)  P.S: There's no steam guides, so what on earth are dreamstones used for? Nothing yet?

It's a cute looking game that has broken/unsatisfying combat. Enemies will all rush you too fast and you can't get away. Guns and umbrella feel like they don't do any damage. Hit boxes are all over the place, enemies attack through walls, and attacks hit you even when your not even close to it. Platforming is hit or miss sometimes you stop sometimes you get near the edge and keep sliding over. This is especially a problem when you have boxes to smash near the edge and everything including yourself go over. Not everytime you hit jump you jump especially if you are even close to the edge. The backwards running mini game in the volcano level is bad, needs to back the camera off the character another space or two. It really needs a map. I don't hate the game and I really do want to see it succeed, but it still needs a lot of work and just can't recommend it right now. I will stick with its development and update in the future. Ps I have a i5-7600k with a Nvidia 1070 and the game runs at or greater than 60fps for me at max settings.

Je signale ceci comme √©tant un bug car par moment, √ßa me fait le coup du boost et parfois pas quand je me fait taper par les craporc, apr√®s, je doute que √ßa sois li√© au niveau, mais des ennemis en g√©n√©ral. (√ßa arrive pas souvent donc √ßa va encore).  Par moment, il m'arrive de vouloir atteindre certaine plateforme en √©tant au pixel pr√®s de celle o√π je me trouve pour saut√© (pas n√©cessaire mais j'aime bien √™tre s√ªr de pouvoir atteindre l'autre plateforme sans √™tre trop court) et par moment, souvent quand je cours, en voulant saut√©, eh bien le perso ne saute pas et tombe car trop pr√®s du bord (non non, c'est pas un manque de skill ou de mauvaise fois, par moment, sans m√™me le vouloir, j'ai bien remarqu√© que le perso ne voulais pas saut√© et c'est comme si elle glissait vers le vide car trop pr√®s du bord) c'est assez particulier mais faut vraiment le ressentir pour le remarqu√© (√† v√©rifier si c'est pas moi qui suis juste mauvais au final).  Au niveau du boss de l'Oasis, j'ai mis quelque try avant de comprendre comment le vaincre car quand on tire dessus avec certaine armes, eh bien on a l'impression que √ßa ne fait rien, pas de hit marqueur ou de signalement rouge, SAUF parfois, √ßa le fait qu'avec le s√®che cheveux et une autre arme que j'ai oubli√© mais du fait que j'ai pas eu cette automatisme de me dire "tien, √ßa clignote pas rouge, donc c'est useless" eh bien, √ßa ma port√© √† la confusion car par moment √ßa le faisait mais c'√©tait tellement court que j'me suis juste dit "tien un bug" ou bien le couldown de l'animation de hit est juste trop court. J'suis pas tr√®s clair mais, tout ceux et celle qui sont arriv√© √† ce boss, rassurez moi que vous aviez aussi le m√™me soucis que moi (faite que je sois pas juste mauvais √† vouloir √™tre logique sur ce que j'ai v√©cu).  Dans l'ensemble, √ßa va encore, le jeu est fort heureusement jouable et appr√©ciable (vivement le doublage de la suite du jeu et d'une option pour pouvoir revoir les cin√©matiques qu'on a d√©couvert dans le jeu via les menus).  Dans les √©v√©nements, j'ai pu tout tester, et il y a plusieurs map o√π l'on peut faire en sorte d'√™tre insensible √† tout les ennemi (sauf ceux arm√©) en √©tant pos√© tranquillement sur une hauteur o√π les ennemis se contente juste d'attendre en dessous de nous, donc pour les map survies, c'est broken, t'a juste √† attendre pour rien et puis t'a gagn√© (sans aucun honneur). Sur une des map o√π il y a la piscine, un ennemi √† r√©ussi √† me faire un damage boost et √† me faire pass√© √† travers un mur, ce qui m'a bloqu√© durant un petit temps, jusqu'√† ce que j'arrive √† me d√©gager dans la zone du dessous sans avoir payer 100 ou 200 perles pour y avoir acc√®s en temps normal.  -Derni√®re chose (pas sp√©cialement un bug) mais il y a 2 plateformes tr√®s pr√©cis√©ment : 1 dans la premi√®re map des natifs au peuple florias o√π l'on peut apercevoir une plateforme au milieu de rien (l√† est tout le probl√®me) o√π l'on peut y apercevoir un bonus qui augmente de 5 la taille maximum de nos balles de nerf. Sauf que bah, c'est inaccessible, par aucun moyen (o√π alors j'ai pas trouv√© mais j'ai vraiment chercher partout, m√™me l√† o√π j'√©tais pas sens√© √™tre. Merci les jeux sans mur invisible, je vous aime car √ßa nous donne une grande sensation de libert√© et de possibilit√©). ps: j'ai malheureusement pas fait gaffe √† ce que pouvait faire l'am√©lioration du s√®che cheveux apr√®s avoir vaincu le boss de l'Oasis. J'ai cru comprendre que √ßa pouvait d√©sormais traverser plusieurs ennemi quand je tire (j'esp√®re que c'est √ßa, sinon, bah tant pis, je sais pas).  Et pour la 2√®me map : c'est dans les mar√©cages o√π il y a aussi une plateforme compl√®tement inaccessible avec le bonus qui nous permet de pouvoir tir√© plus de coup avec le s√®che cheveux avant qu'il sois vide. J'ai chercher un peu partout aussi et pas par au dessus, ni m√™me les mur, pas d'arbre suffisamment proche pour pouvoir y acc√©der, et encore moins tenter le damage boost sur le poisson qui rode dans l'eau qui one shot quand on se fait touch√© (dommage, l'id√©e √©tait bonne...du moins au d√©part).  -Dans l'ensemble, voil√†, c'est tout ce que j'ai pu relev√© si je n'ai rien oubli√©. Tr√®s bon jeu avec √©norm√©ment de surprise encore √† venir et j'ai h√¢te, et vous aussi j'imagine. Franchement, un jeu prometteur, j'ai mis 21 heures de jeu donc : 19~ heures pour arriv√© jusque la fin de l'early acces de la 1.6.2 en prenant le temps de v√©rifier tout les bonus et secret dissimul√© un peu partout dans le jeu. 1h~ pour farmer un secret en boucle afin de pouvoir r√©colter un maximum de perles en un temps avantageux pour obtenir toute les tenues propos√© dans le jeu. Et une 1 pour voir ce que donnait le mode survies, √©v√®nement et versus (j'ai pas d'amis donc j'ai du brancher une manette pour moi m√™me afin de tester le versus). Rien cas voir le nombre de perso jouable, et ceux √† venir, on a plus que h√¢te de les d√©couvrir.  Voil√†, √ßa sera tout, merci √† tout les courageux et courageuse d'avoir lu mon pav√© (j'me vois pas comme une personne faisant des critiques, mais j'avais envie pour une fois de faire quelque chose de compl√®tement objectif et de juste dans ce que je disais afin de vous donn√© une id√©e de mon ressenti et aussi pour ceux et celle voulant d√©couvrir le jeu. Alors FONCEZ, c'est du pur bonheur, surtout quand vous avez les refs en plus, c'est tellement bon !

Bloody fantastic game that looks and feels amazing to play.  Even though this game ain't 100% finished it kinda is the complete package already in my opinion, it's so solid of an experience that each and every thing you encounter feels refined and love crafted in even the smallest of crevices.  Also there is a lot of homage and references to other franchises in video games, movies and comics but I won't spoil the surprise for anyone, just know that my jaw was basically on the floor for most of the time after coming across them in gameplay.  Thank you devs at Crimson Tales for this great start to something not just beautiful but gorgeous, wish you all the best of regards for the future of this game, PEACE OUT!  P.S. Charles Phily's compositions are so calming and catchy that a downloadable soundtrack dlc would be awesome in the future if he and you guys wouldn't mind it :)

Bien qu'il y ai des choses qui pourrai √™tre ajouter pour √©vit√© que l'on se perde aussi facilement (comme par exemple une Map et un rappel des objectifs), et des points a am√©lior√© comme les animations, je prend beaucoup de plaisir a y jouer. This game is still early access so a lot could change but it would need to change drastically for this to end up a decent game. It sort of plays like Ratchet and Clank but the level design is pretty much large open areas and enemies that run at you. The moving around and jumping doesn't feel right, the combat doesn't feel right, the controller support is barely there. So called "secret areas" have portals to them out in the open but the critical path is hidden in a crack in a wall. Nothing feels like it was placed for a reason.  There are various holiday events in the game going back to 2017 so this has been in development for a while but when I look at what is in the game and what they plan on having in the final game it seems like it's gonna take another 3 or so years to even get that far, and that is if they cool it on the events and costumes and just focus on making the core game better.
Adventure mode is great and very reminiscent of Metroid Prime, I recommend.
Still needs a lot of work but good. The fact that they're doing new content and anime makes for more stories. Mods is where it's gonna be at for this game.

Began playing recently, so I'm not aware of whatever improvements were made since launch. 2077 is loaded with immersive lore, character building, and story content so I can't help but recommend it, but Night City itself feels like a boring amalgam of every open-world RPG sandbox released in the last decade. I still *adore* the setting thanks to some stellar environment design, but you'll find yourself running between same-y side-activities if you want to improve your character build.
Great story, you should definitely play this game before you die.
Sad to see as much work put into a game as this one and still have a lot of people hating on it. Try it out. It's a good game for what it is.

I remember launch - it was shitty, I've said from the first trailer that they would not make this game good, because they wanted to pack unlimited stuff in one game, even so I've tried back then, but it was too buggy to play. I can say more, but I would rather spend that time in night city.  11/10

Cyberpunk 2077 is an amazing game. The story, character building, gameplay, particularly and how you interact with each NPC in the game makes it feel like a real life experience.  I can't even express the quality of the level of details that is within the game, every single corner you zoom on a poster or a decor, you see the details & writing like each of them was individually developed.  On top of that, the game is amazingly improving over the month, and became a gem to play compared to the launch release. CD Projekt did and is doing an incredible job working on this game, and you should just realize how rare it is today to have such dedicated & competent developers keep working on a game that has already been released.

Finished the game. Game time will net you 60-80 hours depending on how good you are in puzzles.  The 1st game is a great starting point for any players that are new to the game because of it easy difficulty curve, but the 2nd really picks up the difficulty curve alongside with its story. The twists and ending of the story is fantastic and gives you a sense of accomplishment of solving the case.  And lastly. The music is a banger. Listen to it sometimes...  9/10 would recommend anybody who haven't tried any Ace Attorney games yet.

Amazing game, one of the best visual novels produced. Each case was meaningful and had a new formula that wasn't seen in previous Ace Attorney games, so many twists.  Investigation mechanics were brilliant, all the characters were amazingly written.   No issues with PC Port, Consider purchasing if you're a fan of the visual novel genre. 9/10

This is without a doubt, the best Ace Attorrney game.  It lacks some of the detective stuff you get to do in other games. Like fingerprinting. But you get to do some, and the setting exsplains why there is no heavy reliance on it. (forensic science was still be developed in victorian britain) There's a real steam punky feel to this game. and all the characters are great, and art is gorgeous and the story goes over both games. I looove the prosecutor for this game. His such a gentleman, and his character traits are a joy. And of course, Herlock Sholmes is the BEST. They really captured him so well.  I hope they exsplore this setting more in future. I really would love to see more.

Ace attorney but set in a very realistic, immersive and detailed setting. If you liked the original trilogy or youre a fan of Sherlock Holmes this cannot disappoint.  For new fans: Its not all about being an attorney. The game is about investigating crimes, making allies in a part of the world you've never been to, and defending the accused.  For old fans/ace attorney veterans: It has everything you love from the original trilogy + a more immersive setting, continuity in recurring characters and motifs and new mechanics. You really can't ask for much more to shake up the ace attorney formula.

A great standalone sequel to the Ace Attorney Franchise, providing dozens and dozens of hours of new cases that haven't been released in the West yet.

A couple of subtle tweaks on the AA formula.  The biggest one is Sherlock Holmes' "Logic Spectacular" where the Great Detective does one of his famous cold reads on a suspect or situation and is....almost right (so you can back him up and correct the mistakes). These segments feel like they run just a little bit longer than they should, and I wish you could jump in sooner.  Thematically, there's a more cultural cosmopolitan / ethnocentrism undertone at play due to where and when this story is occurring: at the beginning of the 19th century when Japan is re-opening its borders and is getting pushed around by Great Britain. In past games, the different mixes of east and western cultural felt more like fun set pieces that fed into the set-ups for individual cases. In GAA, it feeds into multiple character motivations for why they feel and act.   This makes almost every case in both games feel like its part of a single story instead of a sort of anthology where the only reason there feels like a story is because of how the leading characters react differently over time (see Ace Attorney 1, where case 3 where nothing about the details of the trial linger further into the plot, it just serves as the trigger for Edgeworth's character growth).  Last little adjustment I like: all of the investigation segments are done in sequence instead of alternating between Investigation and Trial. It feels more natural.  The multiple witness interruption system feels like it could use some more depth, although I'm not sure how. It feels a little empty and gimmicky: if you see a witness interruption, it's always the right choice to follow it.

Great game, awful PC port...  Ever since the original release of Dai Gyakuten Saiban, I've been dreaming of having a chance to play, what can arguably be considered some of the best Ace Attorney games in the franchise. Now finally... 6 years after the original release of Dai Gyakuten Saiban and 4 years after the release of Dai Gyakuten Saiban 2, I finally got to play them... Words cant describe how happy and satisfied I feel having been able to enjoy these games by myself.  -The PC port has some issues- Let's begin with the elephant in the room... Now, it's pretty clear that these are just the mobile versions of both games ported to PC. Even though playable, it's quite clear that these games were not designed to be played on a PC.  Exit game... Where is it??? Seriously, not having an option to exit the game in the main menu was already a pretty bad sign. The only way to exit the game is through the options, which honestly isn't where an average gamer would look for it. Exit game is typically located in the main menu, this is honestly something that should be fixed as soon as possible in my opinion. It's very easy to see how muddy the textures look and how models clip through each other on higher resolutions. Anti-aliasing needs some serious improvements and the game needs more options for the players to finetune the game for their computers, there are only 4 customisable options in the game: Resolution, Windowed/Borderless, AntiAliasing On/Off and V-Sync On/Off.  That's right, the graphics are not customisable, you're not able to tune the frame-rate... Just very barebones settings in general. The frame-rate is locked to 30 by the way, this includes all the main menu animations and this frame cap is there seemingly for no reason whatsoever. And before you say that it's normal to be locked at 30fps, I have to disagree since even the Nintendo Switch version runs  at 60fps.   Luckily there is an amazing mod to fix the frame-rate alongside some other issues:  https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2563613403  And the audio... God, how did Capcom mess this up so bad? Luckily there is also an amazing mod to fix the soundtrack: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2560751137   I do use both of these mods myself, but I have to say that these issues shouldn't have been there to begin with. If you don't want to deal with all this garbage, I would honestly recommend buying the Nintendo Switch version instead if you already own the console. And please Capcom, for the love of god... Fix the PC version ASAP, I honestly expected better from a 39,99‚Ç¨ game.  -Localisation: The Good- Episode 1 The Great Departure is the way Ace Attorney games should be localised. Just the fact that you allowed us to play this game with the Japanese dub instead of the English dub was already a huge step in the right direction. Honestly, that is the way I would love to enjoy the mainline entries in this franchise, give us the option to play the games with the original dub, original character names and Japanese elements. I know I may just be beating a dead horse here by mentioning Ace Attorney Investigations 2, but honestly, I would love to play both Investigations 1 and 2 with a similar localisation seen in Episode 1 The Great Departure. Hell, I would love to play every game in the franchise with that kind of a localisation. Perhaps something worth attempting in a future entry?  -Localisation: The Bad- Now... I have to express that I am disappointed about some characters having their names changed. Now just to be clear, I am not referring to Herlock Sholmes here. I am referring to characters that didn't really have any copyright issue behind their change of name such as: 'Mitrov Stroganov' being renamed to 'Bif Strogenov' , 'Benjamin Dobinbough' being renamed to 'Albert Harebrayne' and most disappointing of all... 'Haori Murasame' being renamed to 'Rei Membami' Some of the changes were completely understandable, but honestly there were a lot of names that should not have been altered to begin with, unfortunately the localisation team went too far with the changes... Again.  -Herlock Sholmes- I know that some people have an issue with the fact that Sherlock Holmes was renamed to Herlock Sholmes and Watson into Wilson. However, this happens to be the only way we're able to enjoy these games in the west. It's not Capcom's fault that Sherlock Holmes has such awful copyright issues. If you want to complain to someone about this, complain to Conan Doyle Estate, since Capcom really didn't have a choice here.  -DGS1- An absolute master piece, I loved every moment of it. I honestly don't really have bad things to mention about this one. Perhaps my only complaint would be the lack of a task list during the investigation sections of the game. The characters were fun and unique, all culprits had solid motivations that even made you somewhat sympathetic of their fate.  -DGS2- I have to say that, DGS2 had a lot to live up to as a sequel to DGS1 and it is clear to see that it was aiming to be even more ambitious than it's predecessor. However, there were a few downsides to the scale of the game. For example, the lack of animated cutscenes was somewhat disappointing as they really contributed to the overall feel of the first game. However, the pros really outweigh the cons in this sequel. It had a significantly better story overall, having more twists and being darker than its prequel. It introduced plenty of new characters and expanded the soundtrack.   -Conclusion- Whether you're new to the franchise or a long time fan of the Ace Attorney games, this is something you absolutely have to play and enjoy for yourself as this is one of a kind masterpiece.

Finally we get this game officially translated, and on PC!  Waited a long time for this and it's really good. I was unsure for a while, but once you finish both games, it shows an amazing mystery story done over both games with hints that have been there all the time - but you won't get them at first.  The characters are great, the music... not as great as other Ace Attorney games in my opinion, but it looks good and the cases and mysteries are all really well done. These games have the best cases overall I would say and while some cases are better than others, overall these games have no super weak cases and as I said before - the cases have so many connections you find later, which is really cool.  Have to strongly recommend this to both newcomers and veterans!

It's nostalgic, yet refreshing. It's like playing the Ace Attorney games, but far more involving. Interesting characters, great music, and a fantastic story. I definitely would recommend you pick it up if you love courtroom drama or investigating.
this series is still as gay as ever.   possibly gayer even

[h1]Summary[/h1]  While this game has some flaws, it is still a fantastic entry in the Ace Attorney franchise: the setting is interesting, the characters are memorable, the humor is on-point, and the plot is cohesive and intriguing. As far as technical details go, the game will run on even a potato of a computer. If you are interested in mystery-themed visual novels with over 50+ hours of content, I highly recommend this game.  [hr][/hr]  [h1]Detailed review[/h1]  [b]Note[/b]: this review is not complete yet. I have only finished 1 of the 2 parts included in this game.  Like the previous games in the franchise, this game is a visual novel with puzzle elements, where each ‚Äúcase‚Äù is spent piecing together the details of some mysterious crime (e.g. murder, theft, etc.). I'm usually not motivated to write reviews, but the amount of enjoyment I had with this game compelled me to write this review.  [h2]Pros[/h2] [list] [*] [b]Game structure[/b]. This game actually consist of two games, subtitled Chronicles and Resolve. However, these two games should actually be thought of as a single, longer game. The game is organized into 10 ‚Äúcases‚Äù that tell a single long, cohesive story (where Chronicles and Resolve have 5 cases each). In contrast, most of the previous games in the franchise felt like a collection of unrelated short stories. [*]  [b]Writing[/b]. The characters are likeable and well-written, especially some of the side characters. The game is packed with humor, but still delivers serious emotional moments successfully. I enjoyed how the plot-twists unfolded, and the writing kept me constantly excited to know what would happen next. [*] [b]Animation[/b]. The characters are expressive and animated well. Some animations are highly exaggerated and are absolutely hilarious. [*] [b]Setting[/b]. The setting is very interesting and not something you would typically expect to see in a game like this: late 19th century/early 20th century at the height of the British Empire and during the rise of the Empire of Japan. [*]  [b]Localization[/b]. I don‚Äôt know any Japanese, but I can tell that the translators did a great job with the localization. The dialogue uses different vocabulary, dialects, and sentence structures for the different characters, which serves to highlight distinct personality traits and quirks. Additionally, the dialogue is full of puns and jokes (which I assume are also present in the original Japanese dialogue). [*] [b]Performance[/b]. The game runs well even with a weak graphics card. In fact, it ran well with a Radeon HD 6770, which is 10 years old. I‚Äôm not sure about how good of a CPU is required, though. [*]  [b]Controls[/b]. Can be played with both mouse/keyboard or controller. There are on-screen prompts in case you forgot what the keybindings are. [*]  [b]Save slots[/b]. Unlike most of the previous Ace Attorney games, you can save at any time, and there are up to 20 save slots. For context, I‚Äôve only played the first AA trilogy, AAI, and AAI2. [/list]  [h2]Neutral[/h2] [list] [*] There is some character dialog that contains sexism, racism, and/or xenophobia. Although some players may find issue with this offensive dialog, it is consistent with the setting in the game (which I mentioned above). [*] [b]Difficulty[/b]. The game is too easy in my opinion. While this is great for newer players or players who only care about the plot (in fact, there is an option in the settings that puts the game on ‚Äústory mode‚Äù and avoids the gameplay altogether), this is disappointing to experienced players (like me). [*] [b]New mechanics[/b]. The game introduces new mechanics such as ‚ÄúGreat Deductions‚Äù and ‚ÄúSummation Examinations.‚Äù Although these are interesting variations of the typical Ace Attorney mechanics, the ones in this game feel too easy and/or too tedious to get through. [*] [b]Case writing[/b]. The cases in this game are not as involved as those of the previous games. Relatively speaking, the game has fewer events occurring in each case, and it instead has more dialogue and more details. Although this seems positive, the problem is that the additional time and details are not well spent (see below). [/list]  [h2]Cons[/h2] [list] [*] [b]Dialogue fluff.[/b] While most of the dialogue is great, there is a lot of fluff. For example, phrases such as ‚Äúwhere is the evidence‚Äù are repeated too often, even in the later cases where this should has already been drilled into both the player and the protagonist. These repetitive phrases could have been omitted without changing the game experience. [*] Relating to the points I made above, some cases drag on about facts that are obvious to the player and are not even worth pointing out, and the protagonist is unable to see these facts immediately. Furthermore, even within those same cases, the protagonist is able to piece together far more obscure facts. These inconsistent behaviors feel more like flaws in the writing rather than intentionally designed parts of the game. [*] There are contrived plot points in some of the cases that left me disappointed and unsatisfied with the way these cases progressed. Combined with the other points I mentioned above, I feel like these cases definitely could have been written in a better way. [*] [b]No volume slider[/b] in the settings. Furthermore, although some other reviews mention the soundtrack, I was unable to hear most of it, even when I increased my system volume to a point where my ears would start hurting in other games. [/list]  [h2]Conclusion[/h2]  Despite these flaws, I immensely enjoyed the characters, plot, and problem-solving aspects of this game. Overall, I highly recommend this game.

Ace Attorney at its' absolute best. Great characters, great music, and a true-to-origin translation (minus Herlock Sholmes/Wilson) unlike the series has ever gotten. It runs beautifully, plays beautifully, and is a fairly easy game to get into, as well as a wonderful introduction to the franchise.

It's yet another (two) great entries in the Ace Attorney series which came out one year before and one year after Spirit of Justice.  So it has some nice twists and mechanics that are fresh to the series (much like all the other games added one or two key gameplay changes, either that be the "Mind Lock" or the "emotion sensor" things added in later games  this is no different in that it adds something fresh while similar,  Story wise so far I have only done the first chapter of the first game to completion but man it was good, yeah there where some "I saw that coming from a mile away" situations, but then there were also some twists that made me guess the wrong evidence and was in interesting surprise.   I can't really give any examples per say since it really is a game you should experience without any spoilers for the most enjoyment, because while the newer games have a lot more game play then say the original, at the end of the day it still is a visual novel with puzzles and as such the novel part is what really makes the game.  Port wise I haven't notices anything bad, I still prefer playing these games on a DS/3DS because of the touch screen, but all in all, the fact that we are finally getting these after 6 years, 100% it is a buy if you like the series at all, great game.
If you like the other Ace Attorney games like me you'll like this one as well.
If you've enjoyed the Ace Attorney series before, you'll definitely enjoy this entry.
ace attorney but its set in hell (england)
El mejor puto juego, sin palabras.
The best AA has to offer. If you're a newcomer to the series, consider picking this up first instead of the original trilogy. The first AA game to legitimately make me cry.

I'd contend these two games are superior to any others in the series. Well executed twists, great mysteries, fun and memorable characters - a true grand slam of Ace Attorney goodness. I hope the side-franchise continues: the ending of Resolve has left me far more excited for a followup to this than I am to the mainline continuity following Spirit of Justice.

Siempre y cuando se juegue con la mentalidad de que estos juegos se hicieron con m√°s de 12 a√±os de iterar sobre la misma franquicia, y que al saltar de vuelta a la trilog√≠a de Phoenix Wright, se van a perder por el camino una serie de elementos 'quality of life' que hacen la experiencia menos tediosa, no veo por qu√© no.  Si bien las primeras entregas de la saga son m√°s simples en el apartado jugable... la narrativa, los personajes, y el humor que caracterizan a la franquicia, sigue estando ah√≠, por lo cual no hay nada que temer. Cada t√≠tulo tiene sus virtudes. Yo siempre recomiendo jugar en orden de salida... Pero mejor empezar por aqu√≠, que no llegar a empezar. No es ning√∫n delito.  ¬øEs el mejor juego de toda la franquicia? No, pero podr√≠a haberlo sido, y me da pena de que se haya quedado cerca de la l√≠nea de meta. Creo que esta divisi√≥n en 2 t√≠tulos que se hizo en su momento hace flaco favor a la historia en la versi√≥n que tenemos entre manos. Si bien lo que se incluye en esta colecci√≥n, es mucha densidad para un juego, no me parece que sea suficiente para justificar dos juegos. El primer t√≠tulo tiene un buen ritmo en lo que respecta a la manera en la que mantiene el inter√©s, introduce elementos y desarrolla los acontecimientos, pero el segundo no tanto, en mi opini√≥n.  Aunque al terminar no quede gota alguna en el tintero, creo que habr√≠a preferido una √∫nica entrega que durase aproximadamente 2/3 de lo que duran ambas aventuras combinadas y contase √∫nicamente lo esencial sin perderse en cuestiones que podr√≠an haberse resumido, y aventuras que a la hora de la verdad, son inconsecuentes para el desarrollo de la trama. Creo que ah√≠ habr√≠amos dado en el clavo con posiblemente la mejor entrega de todos los tiempos. No descarto otra posible re-interpretaci√≥n en forma de trilog√≠a, creo que estructurada de otra manera tambi√©n podr√≠a haber funcionado bastante bien.  En definitiva, una compra segura. Para un seguidor bastante sibarita no est√° sin sus puntos m√°s flacos que otros, pero no deja misterio planteado sin resolver, goza de un memorable elenco de personajes, buena banda sonora, ambientaci√≥n, y un di√°logo con giros y turbulencias que a cualquier fan de la franquicia o de cualquier tipo de narrativa de misterio y detectives gustar√°.  Muy buena colecci√≥n.  (EDIT: Faltas de ortograf√≠a y p√°rrafos)

trovo molto soddisfacente quando capisco il caso un po prima che il gioco mi riveli tutto. gli svilupatori sono riusciti in pieno a darmi le emozioni che volevano quando volevano. √® uno dei migliori giochi investigativi che conosco e sta benissimo alle aspettative di un gioco di Ace Attorney. questa saga non delude mai :D
A great entry in the Ace Attorney series. Make Ace Attorney 7 soon, Capcom!!
